page.title: 17BASILDON NE: DRUG CENTRE I
page.content: The old Rectory Of St. Peter's Church at Nevendon was acquired by volunteers in 1982 and is now the{'Still Waters' {Drug Rehabilitation Centre. It is self-supporting, and makes no charge on the boarders but receives any social security benefits if the boarder is entitled to any. There are beds to accomodate 8 people who are sent from a variety of sources and far more are referred than can be accomodated. The selection is based on need. These people come from all over the country and are mostly heroin addicts. They stay between 9 and 13 months and the aim is not only to break the addiction but to help them regain their self-respect and rehabilitate them by providing them with accomodation and a job (obviously very difficult) wherever possible.
